title: Newly Downloaded App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user just downloaded the app

GIVEN that the user just deleted the storage for that app (clearing storage)
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the app
custom_expected:
THEN the app will start on a clean slate

THEN the user will be able to on-board

title: App Name + Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user downloaded First Pitch app
custom_steps: WHEN the user sees the app in the app screen/home screen of the device
custom_expected:
THEN the First Pitch app icon will be present

THEN the app will have the name "First Pitch"

THEN the First Pitch app will not have a name that contains dash in the middle ("First-Pitch"), QA, Debug, etc.

title: Splash Screen
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user downloaded the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the app
custom_expected: THEN the app will display the splash screen

title: Enable Location //REMOVED-will be on next releases//
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user downloaded the app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the app displays the splash screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Enable Location screen next

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on "Skip" for iOS

WHEN the user taps on "Not Now" for Android
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Select Favorite Team page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Enable Location"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the Enable Location modal will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Allow"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will use the location of the user to find nearby MiLB Teams

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Don't Allow"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will not use the location of the user

title: Select Your Favorite Teams
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user opened the app

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user finishes setting up the Enable Location preferences
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Select Your Favorite Teams page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Next" without selecting any favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will save the user's preferences

THEN the app will display the Scores page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user filters the teams by league/affiliate
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will only display the teams in the selected league/affiliate

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user scrolls through the teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the current team name, team logo, and will display the teams on their correct league

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on an affiliate/a team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be able to see a light blue background in the selected team to indicate selection

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user swaps a team from the Favorite Team and Selected Teams and vice versa
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will reflect the changes made by the user

THEN the app will not crash

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on team(s) and the user hits "Next"

WHEN the user goes back to the "Select Favorite Team" page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will keep the team selections

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Next"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will save the user's preferences

THEN the app will display the Paywall/User Account page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the app displays the My Teams page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will see all of the selected teams

THEN the user will be able to set the favorite team

THEN the user will be able to rearrange the teams using the button on the right-hand side end of the team's row (iOS and Android)

THEN the user will be able to delete teams using the delete button on the left-hand side end of the team's row (iOS only)

THEN the user will be able to a delete team by swiping to the left (Android only)

THEN the user will be able to a set favorite team by swiping to the right (Android only)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Save"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will save the user's preferences

THEN the app will display the Notifications page

title: Notifications
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished the selecting favorite teams

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Save"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the Notifications page

THEN the app will display the Notifications modal (iOS only)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps "Allow" the Notifications modal (iOS only)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the favorite teams selected

THEN the app will allow the user to toggle the News radio buttons for MLB 

THEN the app will allow the user to toggle for following radio buttons for selected favorite teams:

* Game Start
* Game End
* News
* Pitching Change (Android) / Lead Change (iOS)
* Score Change

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps "Don't Allow" the Notifications modal (iOS only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Paywall/User Account page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on radio button(s) for notifications
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will receive notifications depending on the teams/affiliates the user turned the radio button on

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user does not turn on any radio buttons for notifications
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will not receive any notifications

title: Paywall/User Account Page
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished Select Favorite Teams and Notifications on-boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the iOS user hits the Paywall page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* First Pitch logo and background
* $49.99 Yearly button
* $12.99 Monthly button
* Subscriber Login button
* 'Already Purchased? Restore Now' link
* Close button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the Android user hits the User Account page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Email field
* Password field
* Login button
* Skip For Now link button

title: Persistent
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user did not finish on-boarding (user stopped in: 1-Enable Location, 2-Select Favorite Teams, 3-Notifications)
custom_steps: WHEN the user goes back to the app
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the page where the user left off

THEN the app will not allow the user to onboard multiple times (on-boarding is done once on every download of the app)

title: "Back" Button (Android only)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished on-boarding
custom_steps: WHEN navigates to different pages and the user hits the "Back" button
custom_expected:
THEN the app will bring the user to the farthest page (Team page)

THEN the app will not bring back the user to on-boarding

title: Team Page UX/UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team during on boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* TV Icon
* Audio Icon
* Team name and arrow for team picker
* Scoreboard
* Latest (Team News and Team Videos)
* Insider (promotional section)
* Social (Twitter, IG, and FB)
* Info (Roster, Stats, Standings, and Shop)
* Other Affiliates
* More From the Team (iOS only)
* MLB Affiliate logo

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team Page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the navigation bar complete and neat (no typographical errors, no overlapping and/or missing icons/texts)

THEN the wait time for the page to load will not be longer than 5 secs

THEN the user will be able to scroll through the page smoothly 

THEN the app will display the content of that tab in a scale to fit manner (the user will not be able to pinch in/out of the web views)

THEN the users will be able to click on buttons/elements and these will work

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the time hits 10AM ET
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the team page should flip/update

title: Audio Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Team tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Audio icon
custom_expected: THEN the Chrome App will launch a new window at "https://www.milb.com/app-firstpitch/live-stream-games/audio"

title: TV Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Team Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the TV icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Class picker
* Date (Day Month Date)
* Arrows to navigate through the date (next/previous date)
* Video list (if available depending on the selected date)
* Done button

title: Team Picker
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Team tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the arrow beside the team name
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Teams page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user hits the Teams page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Favorite Teams
* Select by MLB Affiliate
* Select by MiLB Class
* All Teams

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on another team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the Team page with the selected team's info

THEN the app will update the everything in the Teams page (team name, team logo, team links, etc.)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Done" without selecting any team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will bring the user to the Team page without any changes

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the team page with the updated info of that team selected

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Select by MLB Affiliate
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display all the 30 MLB clubs 

THEN the 30 MLB clubs will be sorted based on the league (for iOS only)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on an MLB club
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display its affiliates with the correct name and logo

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a MiLB class (Triple-A, Double-A, etc.)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the teams on that class only

THEN the app will display the teams with the correct name and logo

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'View All MiLB Teams'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display all of MiLB teams in alphabetical order

THEN the app will display the teams with the correct name and logo

title: Latest
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the Latest for selected team

THEN the app will display the team's logo and name and the user will be able to read/see these clearly

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "2019 Schedule"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page of 2019 schedule corresponding to that team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Team News"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page of latest news corresponding to that team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Team Videos"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page of latest videos corresponding to that team

title: Insider
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the promotional links of the team under the Insider section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the promotions
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page corresponding to that promotion

title: Social
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the social media icons under the Social section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the icons
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page corresponding to that social media icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on the icons 

AND the user has the app (Twitter/IG/FB)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be redirected to the team's social media

title: Info
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following under the Info section:

* Roster
* Stats
* Standings
* Shop (iOS only)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Roster"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the roster of the selected favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Stats"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the stats page of the selected favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Standings"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the standings page of the selected favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Shop"
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the shop page of the selected favorite team

title: Other Affiliates
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the icons of the other affiliates under Other Team Affiliates section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user scrolls through the carousel
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display other affiliates' icons

THEN the app will not display the currently selected team logo in the carousel

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on an icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will update the Team page info based on the selected icon (Header, team links, logo at the nagivation bar, etc.)

title: Scoreboard UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to Team page
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the scoreboard for the selected favorite team

THEN the scoreboard will display the following:

* Date of the Matchup
* Time of the Matchup (or TBD) 
* Team Matchup (Team name and logo)
* Final Scores or TBD or current score
* Venue of the matchup (iOS only)
* 'Today' button 
* 'Tickets' link button (for scheduled games only)
* 'Gameday' link (for live and final games only)
* Refresh button (Android only)
* Calendar button (Android only)

title: Scoreboard Gestures
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user scrolls (left/right) through the scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be able to navigate the matchups depending on the date the user navigated to

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on today icon
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be brought back to the team's most recent matchup

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Tickets'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the tickets page for that selected favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Gameday'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the gameday page for that selected favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user pulls down the page (iOS only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will refresh the scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Refresh icon (Android only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will refresh the scoreboard

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Calendar icon (Android only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the schedule page for the selected favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Buy tickets for this game' (Android only)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the tickets page for the selected favorite team

title: Scoreboard Data
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user selected a favorite team
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates through the scoreboard
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the correct data

THEN the app will display an appropriate graphics/texts when there is no data available

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Scores tab and there is/are game(s) scheduled for the date selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following: 

* Date picker
* Class picker
* League picker
* Organization picker
* Game information of the matchup(s)
* Team matchup (names and logos)
* Time of the matchup
* Final scores
* Game information

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Scores tab and there is no game scheduled for the date selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the "There are no games scheduled for the date selected." info message

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Scores tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the navigation bar complete and neat (no typographical errors, no overlapping and/or missing icons/texts)

THEN the wait time for the page to load will not be longer than 5 secs

THEN the user will be able to scroll through the page smoothly 

THEN the app will display the content of that tab in a scale to fit manner (the user will not be able to pinch in/out of the web views)

THEN the users will be able to click on buttons/elements and these will work

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Scores tab and there are games scheduled for the date selected
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Current inning/Game status (Final, postponed, etc.)/Game number
* Matchup's team names
* Matchup's team logos
* Matchup's scores
* Game Information

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Game Information'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Player's last name, player's initial, 0-0 (for example), 13.50 ERA (for example)
* P
* AB
* Last Play
* Venue
* Additional game info (if available; for example: Makeup of Apr 15, etc.)

title: Date Picker
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Scores tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on next/previous arrow on the date picker
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to go the next/previous date

THEN the app will update the information in the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the the middle button in the date picker (the button that shows the date)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the calendar

THEN the app will display the month and year buttons at the top of the calendar

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the month button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will show the list of the months

THEN the user will be able to select a month from the list

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the year button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will show the list of the years

THEN the user will be able to select a year from the list

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a date in the calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will update the date (based on the user's selection)

THEN the calendar will collapse

THEN the app will update the information in the page

title: Selecting Another League
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user is in the News tab
custom_steps:
WHEN the user scrolls through the News

WHEN the user taps on a different league
custom_expected:
THEN the app will scroll to the top

THEN the app will display related only to the newly selected league

title: View More/View Less Button
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to News tab

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'View More'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the remaining texts of that article

THEN the 'View More' button will be replaced by 'View Less'

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'View Less'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will hide the some texts of that article

THEN the 'View More' button will be replaced by 'View More'

THEN the user will be brought to the beginning of that article

title: Standings UX/UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished on-boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Standings tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* TV icon
* Audio icon (iOS only)
* Class picker (Triple-A, Double-A, Class A Advanced, Class A, Class A Short Season, Rookie)
* League Filter
* Standings Data (based on the selected class and league filter)
* Foot Notes

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to Standings tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the navigation bar complete and neat (no typographical errors, no overlapping and/or missing icons/texts)

THEN the wait time for the page to load will not be longer than 5 secs

THEN the user will be able to scroll through the page smoothly 

THEN the app will display the content of that tab in a scale to fit manner (the user will not be able to pinch in/out of the web views)

THEN the users will be able to click on buttons/elements and these will work

title: TV Icon
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Standings Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the TV icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Class picker
* Date (Day Month Date)
* Arrows to navigate through the date (next/previous date)
* Video list (if available depending on the selected date)
* Done button

title: Audio Icon (iOS only)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Standings tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Audio icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the Gameday Audio page

THEN the app will not use any third-party application to open this

title: Statistics Key Button
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Stats tab

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user selects a stat in 'Batting'

WHEN the user taps on "Statistics Key" Button at the bottom of the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* G: Games Played
* AB: At Bats
* R: Runs
* H: Hits
* 2B: Doubles
* 3B: Triples
* HR: Home Runs
* RBI: Runs Batted In
* TB: Total Bases
* BB: Bases on Balls (Walks)
* SO: Strikeouts
* SB: Stolen Bases
* CS: Caught Stealing
* OBP: On-base Percentage
* SLG: Slugging Percentage
* AVG: Batting Average
* OPS: On-base Plus Slugging Percentage

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user selects a stat in 'Pitching'

WHEN the user taps on "Statistics Key" Button at the bottom of the page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* W: Wins
* L: Losses
* ERA: Earned Run Average
* G: Games Played
* GS: Games Started
* CG: Complete Games
* SHO: Shutouts
* SV: Saves
* IP: Innings Pitched
* H: Hits Allowed
* R: Runs Allowed
* ER: Earned Runs Allowed
* HR: Home Runs Allowed
* BB: Bases on Balls (Walks) Allowed
* SO: Strikeouts
* WHIPS: Walks + Hits/Innings Pitched
* HLD: Holds

title: More UX/UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished on-boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to More tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* TV icon (iOS only)
* Settings
* Stats (when the user selected a favorite team)
* Player Search 
* Gameday Audio
* MiLB.com Podcast
* MiLBStore.com
* MiLB Auctions
* Ben's Biz Blog (iOS only)
* Prospect Watch
* Playball.org
* First Pitch FAQ
* Subscription Management
* Contact Us
* About MiLB.com
* Blackout Restrictions
* Privacy Policy
* Terms and Conditions
* MLB At Bat
* MLB Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to More tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the navigation bar complete and neat (no typographical errors, no overlapping and/or missing icons/texts)

THEN the wait time for the page to load will not be longer than 5 secs

THEN the user will be able to scroll through the page smoothly 

THEN the user will be able to pinch in/out of the web views

THEN the users will be able to click on buttons/elements and these will work

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on an item
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page associated to that item

title: TV Icon (iOS only)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to More Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on TV icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Class picker
* Date (Day Month Date)
* Arrows to navigate through the date (next/previous date)
* Video list (if available depending on the selected date)
* Done button

title: Notifications (same to the one in On-Boarding)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on "Notifications"
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be able to configure the notifications

THEN the app will push notifications depending on the user's preferences

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user tapped on 'Create a MiLB.com Account'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the MiLB.com Register form

For iOS:

custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on "Notifications"
custom_expected:

THEN the app will save the user's preferences

title: Settings UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Log In to MiLB.com button
* Notifications
* About First Pitch
* Select Favorite Teams
* Reset Your MiLB.com Password
* Create a MiLB.com Account

title: Reset Your MiLB.com Password
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Reset your MiLB.com password'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following: 

* Reset the password to your MiLB.com account
* Email field
* 'Send Reset Request' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the username filed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to type in the username in this field

THEN the field will display the username typed by the user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on 'Send Reset Request' button with valid email address in the field

WHEN the user taps on 'Send Reset Request' button with invalid email address in the field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Settings page

title: No Account Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user has no account logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Log In to MiLB.com button
* Preferences section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Log In to MiLB.com' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the 'Log In With Your MiLB.com Account' form

title: An Account Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user has an account logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* 'Logged into MiLB.com'
* Preferences section
* 'Log Out' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Log Out' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the User Account section of the Settings will be updated (no signed in account scenario)

title: 'Log In With Your MiLB.com Account' Form
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the app displayed the 'Log In With Your MiLB.com Account' Form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the username field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to type in the username in this field

THEN the field will display the username typed by the user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the password field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be able to type in the password in this field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user types the next character of the password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will hide the recently typed character by using ●

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Login" button with valid credentials on the username and password fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display 'Logged in to MiLB.com' at the top of Settings page

THEN the app will display 'Log out of MiLB.com' button at the bottom

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Login" button with invalid credentials on the username and password fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display an error message: "Log in failed"
